benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Add tags to bundle

covered: POST - Valid Payload: Multiple success paths with 201 and JSON array of Tag objects (single, multiple, empty list), optional headers handled, and DB persistence verified.

POST - Invalid Payload & Validation: Robust coverage for malformed/non-array/missing body, invalid tag definition UUIDs, invalid bundleId format, missing required X-Killbill-CreatedBy, and extra fields -> appropriate 400s.
POST - Large Payloads: Boundary (max) and exceeding-max cases covered with expected outcomes.
Server Resilience: 503 service unavailable, 504 timeout, and retry after transient network failure covered; malicious payload rejected.
Regression/Integration/Performance: Duplicate tags not re-created, GET verification of state, performance under normal/peak load, and tolerance of extra unsupported HTTP headers.
gaps: Server Error Handling: No simulation/assertion of 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., unexpected DB exception).

Duplicate Submission/Idempotency: No explicit scenario sending the exact same POST twice to the same bundle to ensure no duplicate tags or unintended side effects; no concurrent same-bundle duplicate test.
Content Negotiation: No checks for response Content-Type application/json; no 415 Unsupported Media Type for wrong/missing Content-Type; no 406 Not Acceptable for unsupported Accept header.
Response Schema: No JSON schema validation of the Tag object against the referenced #/definitions/Tag (only partial field checks).
Body Element Validation: No tests for null/empty-string/non-string items inside the array; no explicit mixed-valid-and-invalid IDs case to confirm all-or-nothing semantics and no partial updates.
Authorization Semantics: 401 covered, but no 403 Forbidden scenario when credentials are valid but permissions are insufficient.
recommendations: Add a 500 Internal Server Error test by simulating an unexpected DB/processing failure and asserting proper 5xx handling and error payload.

Add idempotency tests: send the identical POST payload twice to the same bundle and assert no duplicates and stable response; add concurrent same-bundle duplicate requests to ensure race-safe behavior.
Add content negotiation tests: assert response Content-Type application/json; send requests with incorrect/missing Content-Type -> expect 415; send unsupported Accept -> expect 406.
Validate response schema against the Tag definition (types, required fields, extras not present) using JSON schema validation.
Expand payload validation: include null, empty strings, non-UUID strings, and non-string types within the array; add a mixed valid/invalid IDs test and assert atomicity (no partial writes).
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for a user lacking permissions to add tags, distinct from 401 (unauthenticated).
